ai.summary: Knaresborough Round is a strenuous 61.8 km circular hike in the UK. The route combines long distances with varied terrain and navigational challenges, suitable only for experienced walkers with solid endurance and planning.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rural tracks, farmland paths, hedgerows, occasional road sections, and occasional stiles. Terrain can be muddy after rain; elevation changes are variable, with a cumulative demanding profile. Navigation may require a map or GPS.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard, long-distance hike. Plan carefully: check weather and daylight hours, carry detailed navigation tools (map and compass or GPS) and a charged phone. Pack sufficient water, high-energy food, and a first-aid kit. Wear sturdy, ankle-supporting footwear and bring appropriate clothing, including waterproofs and a insulating layer. Start early to ensure daylight; tell someone your planned route and ETA. Be prepared for farm gates and livestock; follow public rights of way and close gates behind you. In bad conditions, consider shorter sections or postponing.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters)
High-energy snacks and meals for the day or more
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October); winter hikes are more challenging due to shorter days and adverse weather.

seo.title: Knaresborough Round – 61.8 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Knaresborough Round, a challenging 61.8 km circular hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, essential gear, and the best seasons for this demanding route.
